get.description:
Header

- Profile dropdown with the option to change the managed account. There is one main account and an indefinite amount of managed limited accounts. While using a managed account, not all links are shown in navigation menu and any profile-scoped actions are restricted.

patch.description:
Set managed account

Is activated by choosing an account at the account popup.

get.description: List of all interactions of the following type:

patch.description:
The user is asked to choose a payment method in the same multi-step way as while paying. After this, a text input appears with the desired sum. The input is validated in accordance with the balance of the user. The user is then notified on the success of the operation.

If the user is not verified (via support, manually), withdrawal is not available, which is shown by a special warning. However, the user is free to receive money within his account.

example-1.name: Ea ut exercitationem unde natus saepe laborum.

post.description:
id - user id ,
Subscribe

If a user has no plans, it's impossible to subscribe to the user. If the user is unauthorized, the click on the subscribe button opens a quick registration popup / form which leads the user through the necessary authentication steps without the need to leave the page. 

As soon as the user is authorized, if the user doesn't have saved payment methods, a Stripe window pops up where they may tokenize their card. A returned token is stored in the user account and a subscription is created using this method. A user is then prompted to name the card.

If the user already has a card saved, he may either choose the card from the list (by simply pressing confirm and thereby going with the default pick or selecting a card from a list) or by clicking NEW PAYMENT METHOD and going through the tokenization process from the beginning.

It's not possible for the user to subscribe to the same plan twice.

If the subscription is free, the user is subscribed instantly, however, he must have at least one payment method set up and verified. For other financial transactions as well. If no payment methods are set up, the user is prompted to set up a payment method.

The platform commission is set to 20%.

See Annex #3 for extended flow description.

get.description:
Info popup

The info popup contains the last message broadcasted by an admin. It is displayed once to the user and then disappears. It reappears if the promotion changes. The info popup cannot be shown during the first session of the user. The info popup does not contain attachments but may include default design elements.

post.description:
Unlock message

Performs payment for post with PPV (Pay per view) from a saved card. The payment method is chosen in the confirmation popup in the same way as when subscribing or donating.

get.description:
List of users

Each user may have the following buttons: INVOICES, VERIFY, BLOCK/UNBLOCK. It's possible to search for users by name and email. The list is pre-loaded on scroll. Similar loading logic as in posts is applied. It's possible to sort users by each column ascending or descending. There's also a role filter (admins / users).

patch.description:
Mark user as verified

The manual verification via support adds a verified badge to the user profile (not to be confused with email verification, which is automatic and required for all users)

Mark user as blocked
Globally blocks the user (see blocked warning)

get.description:
All invoices of the platform (commissions from payments) are collected here

It's possible to search invoices by user name and username and filter by date

patch.description:
resign from chat

In any chat, the admin has an additional button: RESIGN. By resigning, the admin leaves the chat empty. An empty message with meta=admin_left is sent to the user.

post.description:
Promotion message

This email is sent automatically if an admin broadcasts a message to all users. See Messages component description for more information.

patch.description:
toogle comment

Admins can mark and unmark comments as moderated. Moderated comments are shown as such, their content is not shown.
